Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were grown in 5% CO2 in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum containing penicillin (100 U/mL) and streptomycin (50 lg/mL).

Readout description.Result Description: Cells overexpressing PINK1 A244G showed no significant difference in cell viability compared to controls after staurosporine treatment, with TUNEL-positive cells at (33.3 ± 1.6)% vs. (36.0 ± 1.4)% in controls.

Cells overexpressing PINK1 V317I showed no significant difference in cell viability compared to controls after staurosporine treatment, with TUNEL-positive cells at (35.7 ± 1.6)% vs. (36.0 ± 1.4)% in controls.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of apoptotic cells was obtained counting TUNEL-positive cells in 10 random microscopic fields from different slides in each of three replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells overexpressing wild-type PINK1 were used as a positive control, showing significantly lower levels of apoptosis compared to control cells.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with empty vector were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analysis was performed with SPSS software v. 12.0 using one-way analysis of variance and post hoc multiple comparisons with Bonferroni correction.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Apoptosis levels significantly lower than control cells after staurosporine treatment, e.g., TUNEL-positive cells < 30%.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Apoptosis levels similar to or higher than control cells after staurosporine treatment, e.g., TUNEL-positive cells ≥ 33%.

Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were grown in 5% CO2 in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum containing penicillin (100 U/mL) and streptomycin (50 lg/mL).

Readout description.Result Description: Western Blotting showed that activated caspase-3 levels were not reduced in PINK1 A244G cells compared to controls after staurosporine treatment.
Western Blotting showed that activated caspase-3 levels were not reduced in PINK1 V317I cells compared to controls after staurosporine treatment.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells overexpressing wild-type PINK1 were used as a positive control, showing reduced activated caspase-3 levels compared to control cells.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with empty vector were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant reduction in activated caspase-3 levels compared to control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No reduction in activated caspase-3 levels compared to control cells.
